Personal Projects

SafetyTab

SafetyTab is a Google Chrome extension that allows users to quickly access a new tab loaded with a website from a predetermined list. This is perfect for when you need to pretend to do homework as you parents look over your shoulder!

Languages: Javascipt, HTML, CSS + Chrome's Javascript API's

CodeNotes

CodeNotes is a dual purpose editor for computer science students. It allows for rich text editing as well as text-editing for code.

Languages: JavaScript, CSS, HTML

School Projects

Puzzle Solver

This a program that is able to solve Peg Solitaire Puzzles, MN Puzzles, Word Ladder Puzzles and Sudoku puzzles using either Breadth-first search or Depth-first search.

Written in python it uses classes, objects, recursion, and queues.

Final Grade: 92 %

Code available upon request.

Text Adventure Game

This is a small text adventure game where the user walks around the University of Toronto mississauga campus, trying to collect items before the big exam!

Final Grade: 90%

Code available upon request.

Open Source Contributions

Learn X in Y Minutes

Learn X in Y Minutes is a quick way to get caught up in the syntax of any programming language. I updated the Python 3 page to include information on the high common range function.

This project was my first time really using git, and learning about forks, branches, commits, and pull requests.

Language: Markdown

Duck Duck Go Instant Answers

Create a geometry formulea cheat cheet that appears as an instant answer on the Duck Duck Go search answer when one searches 'geometry formula cheat sheet'.

Language: The cheat sheet appears as a .json file.

Recent Blog Posts

Google Extensions - Using Variables as Object Keys

Recently, I just finished creating my first google chrome extension, called SafetyTab. Now, google chrome extensions are relatively simple to create, as long as you know some HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (including asynchronous JavaScript).

The documentation provided by google is simple, straightforward and they have a lot of samples to look at. Not to mention, there is a wealth of tutorials available online. I highly encourage anyone looking for a quick coding project to try and create a google chrome extension.
